intro: Rhodiola krivochizhinii, commonly known as the Trans-Altaic rhodiola, is a perennial flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Crassulaceae and is characterized by its fleshy, evergreen leaves and small, pink or white flowers. The plant thrives in high-altitude environments, often growing in rocky soils and alpine meadows. It is well adapted to cold climates and can tolerate extreme temperature fluctuations. Rhodiola krivochizhinii is also known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional medicine for its adaptogenic effects.
